text: Chiller type, model, and capacity match mechanical schedule and load calculations
Shop drawings approved: electrical, piping, dimensions, access, and structural supports
Seismic supports and spring isolators coordinated and detailed (if applicable)
Equipment delivered with data plate, start-up manuals, pressure tests, and safety labeling
Chiller positioned correctly, level, and anchored per manufacturer recommendations
Chilled water supply/return piping connected with strainers, pressure/temp ports, isolation valves
Condenser water loop (for water-cooled) connected with proper treatment ports and flow balancing devices
Electrical connections: starters, disconnects, overloads, and fusing confirmed with single-line diagram
Temperature sensors, flow switches, and safeties installed and wired to BAS/DDC
VFD (if applicable) installed and programmed per sequence
Chilled water system flushed, leak-tested, and cleaned before startup
Pre-start checklist completed by manufacturer-certified technician
Refrigerant levels, oil levels, suction/discharge pressures within spec
Chiller started, stabilized, and load test conducted for full capacity
Commissioning forms, trend logs, and final TAB airflow/waterflow verified
Warranty registration, logbook, and O&M manuals submitted

id: • CSA B52 (Refrigeration), Manufacturer Specs: Carrier, Daikin, Trane, York, Multistack, McQuay
